content.question: The capacitor is connected to a battery and allowed to reach equilibrium. A charge of magnitude <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is on each of the capacitorâ€™s plates. The same battery is then connected to a new capacitor with identical dimensions but with a dielectric that has three times the dielectric constant of the original. When equilibrium is reached, what is the magnitude of the charge on one plate of the new capacitor?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
